instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0amps
threads.message:
Hello!

Can not get 20 volts on this board. Customer says that for last 2 days charging was unstable, then laptop just turned off

Now there is 3 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> in the loop, UB400 stable
Board is clean, no corrosion, no oxidation
Found blown resistor RB036 ( replaced)
Already changed UB400 ( 2 times, with known-good chip), UB300 (just for case), QB400 and UB090 (from same donor board) - still 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is present
All <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> except UB400 has 1.1 LDOs
Compared all LDOs in diode mode with other chips-it is similar (0.470 - 0.500)
Checked all resistors around UB400 and UB300 - values matching schematic
Checked all traces under UB400 - no problem there.

What else might cause this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0amps
threads.message:
You should put back UB090; if the new one is not from the same donor board model.

Something wrong near UB400.
Compare diode mode readings with <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, on all surrounding components; not only the LDOs.
Check RB305/405.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0amps
threads.message: Found the problem near UB300. After i removed metal shield around <CHIP>U9290</CHIP> i saw that pins of RB305 and RB303 doesn't looks good. After resoldering all of the resistors in this row mac turns on. Thank you very much
